intro: Vonitra loucoubensis, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a glossy surface. Vonitra loucoubensis is typically found in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar.
